event: Earliest human presence in present-day Bolivia
Early agriculture develops in the Andean highlands
Permanent settlements form around Lake Titicaca
Tiwanaku civilization emerges near Lake Titicaca
Tiwanaku reaches its political and cultural peak
Collapse of Tiwanaku leads to Aymara regional kingdoms
Inca Empire incorporates much of present-day Bolivia
Spanish conquest of the Andean region begins
Silver discovered at Potosí, transforming the region
Potosí becomes one of the world’s largest cities
Aymara uprising under Túpac Katari besieges La Paz
Early independence revolts erupt in Upper Peru
Bolivia declares independence
Modern Bolivian state is consolidated
War of the Pacific costs Bolivia its coastline
Tin mining replaces silver as economic backbone
National Revolution introduces land and mining reforms
Che Guevara is captured and executed in Bolivia
Return to civilian democratic rule
First Indigenous president takes office
